properties.senderName: NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 11 at 9:16AM MST until February 12 at 5:00AM MST by NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM EXPECTED TO BRING HEAVY SNOW OVER MOUNTAIN
AREAS...

Upper level closed low is expected to combine with a strong cold
front to bring winter weather conditions over the Gila Region and
Sacramento Mountains today through early Wednesday morning.
Temperatures will drop below freezing behind the front which will
allow the transition from rain to snow. Periods of moderate to
heavy snow are possible with this system resulting in snow
accumulations of 6 to 10(+) inches in the Sacramento Mountains,
and areas above 7500 feet in the Gila Region, with isolated
higher amounts possible. The snow should end by Wednesday
morning.

* WHAT...Winter Storm Warning for areas above 7500 feet, with
heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 10
inches, with locally higher amounts possible over the Black
Range.

* WHERE...Portions of southwest New Mexico, primarily the Black
Range and Gila Wilderness.

* WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Wednesday.

* TIMING... Occasional moderate to heavy snow through early
Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS... Travel could be very difficult. Some roads could
become impassable and/or closed.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and drive to
accommodate the current conditions.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY
